title: Boggle
maintext: Shake the grid of cubes and place it on the table. Remove the lid and push unslotted cubes into holes.
For 4 minutes: each player makes a list of 4+ letter words spelled from continuous strings of cubes on the grid, connected adjacently or diagonally, using cubes once max per word.
Players recite their lists in turn. Cross out non-Scrabble approved words and all words on more than one list.
Remaining words are worth their length minus 3 points, except affixes which are always worth 1.
Words made by tacking common prefixes or suffixes to a base word that don't form a new word with a distinct meaning are affixes.
'Findings' is find+ing+s, and so is an affix. It's worth 1 point.
'Submarine' is sub+marine but it means something distinct from sub+marine, and so is worth the full (9 - 3 =) 6 points.
Common prefixes: de, dis, mis, out, over, pre, re, sub, un, under
Common suffixes: s, es, ed, ied, er, ier, ing, ly, y
